info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:30PM CDT until April 01 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL MARSHALL...NORTHWESTERN BENTON...SOUTHERN FAYETTE AND SOUTHWESTERN HARDEMAN COUNTIES... At 829 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Slayden, or 13 miles east of Collierville, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado, golf ball size hail, and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Somerville, Mt Pleasant, Lagrange, Michigan City, Slayden, Macon, Piperton, Rossville, Moscow, Williston, Grand Junction, La Grange, Laconia, Early Grove, Taska, Hays Crossing, Pattersonville, Forty Five and Ghost River State Natural Area. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
